N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 88.4 - Books and records

State Regulations
(a) Alcoholic
beverages and nonalcoholic beverages. Each licensee shall maintain on the
licensed premises adequate books and records of all transactions pertaining to
alcoholic beverages, as required by section
104
of the Alcoholic Beverage Control Law
and the rules or regulations of the authority, and, in addition, shall maintain
an accounts-receivable ledger which, at all times, shall reflect the actual
status of all accounts to whom nonalcoholic beverages are sold. Such ledger may
be combined with the alcoholic beverages ledger, provided that separate columns
are provided therein for data relative to alcoholic beverages and nonalcoholic
beverages. (b) The sale of
nonalcoholic beverages and other products permitted to be sold pursuant to
section
104, subdivision
1, of the Alcoholic Beverage Control Law shall be recorded either on a separate
invoice or on the same invoice used to record the sale of alcoholic
beverages. (c) Cash sales. Receipts
from sales of alcoholic beverages and sales of nonalcoholic beverages shall be
separately registered. Notes
